Uses of SequenceSpectrum in edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings
 

Classes in edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings with type parameters of type SequenceSpectrum
 interface SequenceSpectrum<T extends SequenceSpectrum>
          Represents a statistical model of a sequence of bytes.
 

Classes in edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings that implement SequenceSpectrum
 class DoubleKcount<T extends DoubleKcount>
          Represents the counts of a set of given patterns appearing in a string.
 class HierarchicalSpectrum<T extends HierarchicalSpectrum>

          Represents the counts of a set of given patterns appearing in a string.
 class Kcount<T extends Kcount>
           
 class MarkovTreeNode
          A node in a tree where each transition is labeled by a byte and has a local probability (that is, conditional on the parent node).
 class RonPSA
           
 class RonPSANode
          Extends a MarkovTreeNode with backlinks, for making make a Probabilistic Suffix Automaton (PSA).
 class RonPST
          A probabilistic suffix tree, as described in

D.

 void RonPSTNode.copyProbsFrom(SequenceSpectrum spectrum)
          Recursively fills out the tree so that each node has either a complete set of probabilities or none at all, and assigns conditional probabilities according to the given spectrum.
 void MarkovTreeNode.copyProbsFromSpectrumRecursively(SequenceSpectrum spectrum)
          Recursively fills out the tree so that each node has either a complete set of children or none at all, and assigns conditional probabilities according to the given spectrum.
